purpose: Highlight the negative perceptions of data science among students.
title: Data science has an image problem: Negative perceptions of data science are widespread among many students

bullets.text: Bad rap: Many STEM men and women have a negative perception of the field as abstract, theoretical, lacking impact and purpose
Students are simply picking up on the reality, with many companies still struggling to drive impact with AI
Companies are not doing enough to spotlight the purpose and value-add of data science in their businesses
Students in Japan and China have the strongest view of data science as theoretical and low-impact (with ~60% each)

supporting_facts: See also the 2019 MIT Sloan/BCG joint report "Winning with AI" (https://sloanreview.mit.edu/projects/winning-with-ai/)
Source: BCG Women in Data survey 2020
reasoning_strategy: Present survey results and expert opinions to illustrate the issue.
layout: Two-column layout with text and infographic

content_zones.left: Title, survey description, infographic with gender representation and percentages
content_zones.right: Bulleted list of insights and survey results

chart.title: Share of students who view the field of data science as abstract and of low tangible impact (in %)
